p.strong: Hit Points. Hit Dice: 1d8 per Scout level. Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier. Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Scout level after 1st.

Proficiencies. Armor: Light Armour. Weapons: Simple Blasters, Sniper Rifle, Cycler Rifle, Vibrodagger, Vibro Double-Blade, Electrostaff, Electrowhip, Electrobaton. Saving Throws: Dexterity and Intelligence.
Skills. Choose 4 from Acrobatics, Athletics, Deception, Insight, Intimidation, Investigation, Perception, Persuasion, Sleight of Hand, Stealth.

sheet.description: An agile specialist combining stealth, cunning, and precision.

setters.set: An agile specialist combining stealth, cunning, and precision.
Light armor, Slicing Kit, one skill from the class's skill list

description.p: Once per turn, you can deal an extra 1d6 damage to one creature you hit with an attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse or a ranged weapon.
You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't incapacitated, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.
The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Sneak Attack column of the Scout table.

sheet.description: Once per turn, deal extra {{sneak-attack:dice}} damage when you hit with advantage using a finesse or ranged weapon. No advantage needed if enemy of target is within 5 feet and not incapacitated.

description.p: At 1st level, choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
At 6th level, you can choose two more of your proficiencies to gain this benefit.
Your quick thinking and agility allow you to move and act quickly. You can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide actions as a Bonus Action.

sheet.description: You can take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide actions as a Bonus Action.

description.p: When you roll for initiative, you can move up to your speed before initiative order is determined. This can be used once per long rest.

sheet.description: When you roll for initiative, you can move up to your speed before initiative order is determined.

description.p: At 3rd level, you choose a subclass that defines your specialized path: Thief, Assassin, or Operative. Your choice grants you features at 3rd level and again at 9th, 13th, and 17th level.

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 10th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

sheet.description: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can halve the attack's damage against you.

description.p: You can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

sheet.description: When you make a Dexterity saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, you take no damage on a success and half damage on a failure.

description.p: You gain a feature from your Scout subclass.
You gain a feature from your Scout subclass.
You gain a feature from your Scout subclass.

By 11th level, you have refined your chosen skills until they approach perfection. Whenever you make an ability check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

sheet.description: Whenever you make an ability check that lets you add your proficiency bonus, you can treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

description.p: By 15th level, you have acquired greater mental strength. You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

sheet.description: You gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

description.p: Beginning at 18th level, you are so evasive that attackers rarely gain the upper hand against you. No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't incapacitated.

sheet.description: No attack roll has advantage against you while you aren't incapacitated.

description.p: At 20th level, you have an uncanny knack for succeeding when you need it. Your Dexterity and Intelligence scores increase by 2. Your maximum for those scores increases by 2. Additionally, if your attack misses a target within range, you can turn the miss into a hit. Alternatively, if you fail an ability check, you can treat the d20 roll as a 20. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

sheet.description: Your Dexterity and Intelligence scores increase by 2 (max 22). If your attack misses, you can turn it into a hit. Alternatively, if you fail an ability check, you can treat the roll as a 20.

description.p: Thieves are masters of stealth, acrobatics, and getting into places others can't reach.
You can use the Bonus Action granted by your Cunning Action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your Slicing Kit to disarm a trap, or open a lock.

sheet.description: You can use the Bonus Action granted by your Cunning Action to make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check, use your Slicing Kit to disarm a trap, or open a lock.

description.p: You gain the ability to climb faster than normal; climbing no longer costs extra movement.

sheet.description: Climbing no longer costs extra movement.

description.p: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

sheet.description: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks if you move no more than half your speed on the same turn.

description.p: Choose between gaining Forgery Kit proficiency or Hacker Kit proficiency.

sheet.description: Choose between gaining Forgery Kit proficiency or Hacker Kit proficiency.

description.p: You can take two turns during the first round of any combat encounter. You take your first turn at your normal initiative and your second turn at initiative minus 10. You can't use this feature if you are surprised.

sheet.description: You can take two turns during the first round of any combat encounter. You take your first turn at your normal initiative and your second turn at initiative minus 10. You can't use this feature if you are surprised.

description.p: Assassins are trained killers who specialize in eliminating targets quickly and quietly.
Gain Poisoning Kit proficiency.

sheet.description: Gain Poisoning Kit proficiency.

description.p: You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in combat yet. Any hit against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

sheet.description: You have advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn in combat yet. Any hit against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

description.p: Gain proficiency with Forgery Kit and Disguise Kit.

sheet.description: Gain proficiency with Forgery Kit and Disguise Kit.

description.p: You have advantage on initiative rolls. The first creature you hit during the first round of combat is easier for you and others to strike; attack rolls against that target have advantage until the end of your next turn.

sheet.description: You have advantage on initiative rolls. The first creature you hit during the first round of combat is easier for you and others to strike; attack rolls against that target have advantage until the end of your next turn.

description.p: When you attack and hit a surprised creature, it must make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 + your Dexterity modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, double the damage of your attack. On a successful save, your attack does normal damage.

sheet.description: When you attack and hit a surprised creature, it must make a Con save. On a failed save, double the damage of your attack.

description.p: Operatives are agile combatants who use mobility and tactics to outmaneuver their foes.
You can move up to half your speed rounded up as a Reaction when an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

sheet.description: When an enemy ends its turn within 5 feet of you, you can move up to half your speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

description.p: When you are targeted by an attack while a creature within 5 feet of you is granting you cover, you can use your Reaction to have the attack target that creature instead of you.

sheet.description: When targeted by an attack while a creature within 5 feet grants you cover, you can have the attack target that creature instead.

description.p: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet. If you have a climbing or swimming speed, this increase applies to that speed as well.

sheet.description: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet (also applies to climb/swim speeds).

description.p: You can use the Help action as a Bonus Action, and you can adopt a Fighting Style.

sheet.description: You can use the Help action as a Bonus Action, and you can adopt a Fighting Style.

description.p: If you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make one additional attack as a Bonus Action. This attack can benefit from your Sneak Attack even if you have already used it this turn, but you can't use Sneak Attack against the same target more than once per turn.

sheet.description: If you take the Attack action, you can make one additional attack as a Bonus Action. This attack can benefit from Sneak Attack even if already used this turn (but not against the same target).
